comment_text.mn15:1.2: The Bhaggas were an isolated republican clan, sandwiched between the Vacchas south of the Yamuna and the Kosalans north of the Ganges. By the time of the Buddha they were evidently subject to the Vacchas. | “Crocodile’s Bellow” (susumāragira) was their capital. The commentary it was was so-named because a crocodile bellowed in a nearby lake during the founding of the city.
comment_text.mn15:1.3: While Moggallāna is known for his mastery of advanced psychic abilities, suttas such as this and MN 5 show his concern for even the smallest defects in ethical conduct.
comment_text.mn15:2.1: The term “invites” (pavāreti) suggests a connection with the “Invitation” (pavāraṇā) ceremony at the end of each rains retreat, where the monastics invite each other for admonition (Kd 4). The Chinese parallels confirm this connection, saying the discourse was spoken on the Pavāraṇā.
comment_text.mn15:2.2: This discourse acts as a sutta counterpart to the Vinaya rule Bu Ss 12, which lays down a procedure to deal with a mendicant who makes themselves incorrigible. The Pali origin story for that rule lays the blame on the monk Channa, the Buddha’s former charioteer, who boasts “mine is the Buddha, mine the Dhamma!” It was evidently unsuccessful, as the Buddha on his deathbed had to further lay down the “divine punishment” for him (DN 16:6.4.1).
comment_text.mn15:3.32: Apadāna means the traces or marks left behind, in this case the evidence of misdeeds.
comment_text.mn15:6.1: “Should measure against” is anuminitabba, which in its noun form anumāna lends the sutta its title. The normal sense in later literature is “inference” (eg. Mil 6.4.1). Anumāna occurs in the early texts only here and in the passive form anumīyati at SN 22.36:1.4, where the sense must be to “measure against”. This passage also discusses how to measure oneself in relation to another, an external standard, whereas the next section on reflection applies an inner standard. Hence the commentary glosses with: “should compare, should judge” (tuletabbo tīretabbo).
comment_text.mn15:8.3: Moggallāna also takes part in a similar conversation about blemishes at MN 5:3.1.
comment_text.mn15:8.7: The Chinese parallels continue at this point, expanding the sequence that leads from joy to immersion to insight and liberation.
comment_text.mn15:8.9: The commentary says that the ancient teachers called this the “Bhikkhupātimokkha”, perhaps an echo of the memory that it was recited on the pavāraṇā, which replaces the recitation of the Pātimokkha normally held on the full moon day. It goes on to say that a mendicant should use these teachings to review themselves three times a day, or at least once.

root_text.mn15:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
root_text.mn15:1.3: Tatra kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi:
root_text.mn15:1.5: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa paccassosuṁ.
root_text.mn15:2.2: ‘vadantu maṁ āyasmanto, vacanīyomhi āyasmantehī’ti, so ca hoti dubbaco, dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato, akkhamo appadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṁ, atha kho naṁ sabrahmacārī na ceva vattabbaṁ maññanti, na ca anusāsitabbaṁ maññanti, na ca tasmiṁ puggale vissāsaṁ āpajjitabbaṁ maññanti.
root_text.mn15:3.2: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu pāpiccho hoti, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato.
root_text.mn15:3.3: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu pāpiccho hoti, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato—
root_text.mn15:3.5: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu attukkaṁsako hoti paravambhī.
root_text.mn15:3.8: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhābhibhūto.
root_text.mn15:3.11: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu upanāhī.
root_text.mn15:3.12: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu upanāhī—
root_text.mn15:3.14: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu abhisaṅgī.
root_text.mn15:3.15: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhahetu abhisaṅgī—
root_text.mn15:3.17: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā.
root_text.mn15:3.18: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu kodhano hoti kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā—
root_text.mn15:3.20: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ paṭippharati.
root_text.mn15:3.21: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ paṭippharati—
root_text.mn15:3.23: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeti.
root_text.mn15:3.24: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeti—
root_text.mn15:3.26: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti.
root_text.mn15:3.27: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti—
root_text.mn15:3.29: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
root_text.mn15:3.30: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti—
root_text.mn15:3.32: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati.
root_text.mn15:3.33: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati—
root_text.mn15:3.35: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu makkhī hoti paḷāsī.
root_text.mn15:3.38: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu issukī hoti maccharī.
root_text.mn15:3.41: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu saṭho hoti māyāvī.
root_text.mn15:3.44: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu thaddho hoti atimānī.
root_text.mn15:3.47: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī.
root_text.mn15:3.48: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī—
root_text.mn15:4.2: ‘vadantu maṁ āyasmanto, vacanīyomhi āyasmantehī’ti, so ca hoti suvaco, sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato, khamo padakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṁ, atha kho naṁ sabrahmacārī vattabbañceva maññanti, anusāsitabbañca maññanti, tasmiñca puggale vissāsaṁ āpajjitabbaṁ maññanti.
root_text.mn15:5.2: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu na pāpiccho hoti, na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato.
root_text.mn15:5.3: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu na pāpiccho hoti na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato—
root_text.mn15:5.5: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu anattukkaṁsako hoti aparavambhī.
root_text.mn15:5.8: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhābhibhūto.
root_text.mn15:5.9: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhābhibhūto—
root_text.mn15:5.11: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu upanāhī.
root_text.mn15:5.12: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu upanāhī—
root_text.mn15:5.14: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī.
root_text.mn15:5.15: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī—
root_text.mn15:5.17: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā.
root_text.mn15:5.18: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu na kodhano hoti na kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā—
root_text.mn15:5.20: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ nappaṭippharati.
root_text.mn15:5.21: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ nappaṭippharati—
root_text.mn15:5.23: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ na apasādeti.
root_text.mn15:5.24: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakaṁ na apasādeti—
root_text.mn15:5.26: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa na paccāropeti.
root_text.mn15:5.27: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena codakassa na paccāropeti—
root_text.mn15:5.29: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena na aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, na bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
root_text.mn15:5.30: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena na aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, na bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti—
root_text.mn15:5.32: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne sampāyati.
root_text.mn15:5.33: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu codito codakena apadāne sampāyati—
root_text.mn15:5.35: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu amakkhī hoti apaḷāsī.
root_text.mn15:5.38: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu anissukī hoti amaccharī.
root_text.mn15:5.41: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu asaṭho hoti amāyāvī.
root_text.mn15:5.44: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu atthaddho hoti anatimānī.
root_text.mn15:5.47: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī.
root_text.mn15:5.48: Yaṁpāvuso, bhikkhu asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti, anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī—
root_text.mn15:6.1: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ anuminitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:6.2: ‘yo khvāyaṁ puggalo pāpiccho, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.3: ahañceva kho panassaṁ pāpiccho pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.4: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na pāpiccho bhavissāmi, na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.5: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo attukkaṁsako paravambhī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.6: ahañceva kho panassaṁ attukkaṁsako paravambhī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.7: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anattukkaṁsako bhavissāmi aparavambhī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.8: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo.
root_text.mn15:6.9: Ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhābhibhūto, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.10: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhābhibhūto’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.11: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.12: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.13: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu upanāhī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.14: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.15: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.16: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.17: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.18: ahañceva kho panassaṁ kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.19: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘na kodhano bhavissāmi na kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāressāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.20: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakaṁ paṭippharati, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.21: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṁ paṭipphareyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.22: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṁ nappaṭippharissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.23: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.24: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakaṁ apasādeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.25: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakaṁ na apasādessāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.26: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena codakassa paccāropeti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.27: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena codakassa paccāropeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.28: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena codakassa na paccāropessāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.29: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.30: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicareyyaṁ, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmeyyaṁ, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukareyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.31: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena na aññenaññaṁ paṭicarissāmi, na bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmessāmi, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.32: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo codito codakena apadāne na sampāyati, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.33: ahañceva kho pana codito codakena apadāne na sampāyeyyaṁ, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.34: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘codito codakena apadāne sampāyissāmī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.35: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo makkhī paḷāsī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.36: ahañceva kho panassaṁ makkhī paḷāsī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.37: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘amakkhī bhavissāmi apaḷāsī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.38: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo issukī maccharī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.39: ahañceva kho panassaṁ issukī maccharī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.40: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘anissukī bhavissāmi amaccharī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.41: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo saṭho māyāvī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.42: ahañceva kho panassaṁ saṭho māyāvī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.43: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asaṭho bhavissāmi amāyāvī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.44: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo thaddho atimānī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.45: ahañceva kho panassaṁ thaddho atimānī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.46: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘atthaddho bhavissāmi anatimānī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:6.47: ‘Yo khvāyaṁ puggalo sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ayaṁ me puggalo appiyo amanāpo;
root_text.mn15:6.48: ahañceva kho panassaṁ sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī, ahampāssaṁ paresaṁ appiyo amanāpo’ti.
root_text.mn15:6.49: Evaṁ jānantenāvuso, bhikkhunā ‘asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī bhavissāmi anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī’ti cittaṁ uppādetabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.1: Tatrāvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.2: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi pāpiccho, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.3: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.4: ‘pāpiccho khomhi, pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.5: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.6: ‘na khomhi pāpiccho, na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.7: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.9: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.10: ‘attukkaṁsako khomhi paravambhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.11: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.12: ‘anattukkaṁsako khomhi aparavambhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.13: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.15: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.16: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhābhibhūto’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.17: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.18: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhābhibhūto’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.19: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.21: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti ‘kodhano khomhi kodhahetu upanāhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.22: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhahetu upanāhī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.23: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.25: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.26: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.27: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.28: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhahetu abhisaṅgī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.29: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.30: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.31: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.32: ‘kodhano khomhi kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.33: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.34: ‘na khomhi kodhano kodhasāmantā vācaṁ nicchāretā’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.35: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.36: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi codito codakena codakaṁ paṭippharāmī’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.37: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṁ paṭippharāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.38: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.39: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṁ nappaṭippharāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.40: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.41: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi codito codakena codakaṁ apasādemī’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.42: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṁ apasādemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.43: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.44: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakaṁ na apasādemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.45: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.46: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi codito codakena codakassa paccāropemī’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.47: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.48: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakassa paccāropemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.49: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.50: ‘codito khomhi codakena codakassa na paccāropemī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.51: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.52: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi codito codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarāmi, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmemi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.53: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.54: ‘codito khomhi codakena aññenaññaṁ paṭicarāmi, bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmemi, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.55: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.56: ‘codito khomhi codakena na aññenaññaṁ paṭicarāmi, na bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmemi, na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaromī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.57: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.58: ‘kiṁ nu khomhi codito codakena apadāne na sampāyāmī’ti?
root_text.mn15:7.59: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.60: ‘codito khomhi codakena apadāne na sampāyāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.61: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.62: ‘codito khomhi codakena apadāne sampāyāmī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.63: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.65: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.66: ‘makkhī khomhi paḷāsī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.67: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.68: ‘amakkhī khomhi apaḷāsī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.69: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.71: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.72: ‘issukī khomhi maccharī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.73: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.74: ‘anissukī khomhi amaccharī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.75: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.77: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.78: ‘saṭho khomhi māyāvī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.79: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.80: ‘asaṭho khomhi amāyāvī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.81: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.83: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.84: ‘thaddho khomhi atimānī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.85: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.86: ‘atthaddho khomhi anatimānī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:7.87: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhunā attanāva attānaṁ evaṁ paccavekkhitabbaṁ:
root_text.mn15:7.89: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.90: ‘sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī khomhi ādhānaggāhī duppaṭinissaggī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā tesaṁyeva pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:7.91: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno evaṁ jānāti:
root_text.mn15:7.92: ‘asandiṭṭhiparāmāsī khomhi anādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī’ti, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:8.1: Sace, āvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme appahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā sabbesaṁyeva imesaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:8.2: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme pahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ, ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesu.
root_text.mn15:8.3: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā, daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko, ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte, acche vā udakapatte, sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno, sace tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, tasseva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati;
root_text.mn15:8.4: no ce tattha passati rajaṁ vā aṅgaṇaṁ vā, teneva attamano hoti:
root_text.mn15:8.6: Evameva kho, āvuso, sace bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme appahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā sabbesaṁyeva imesaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya vāyamitabbaṁ.
root_text.mn15:8.7: Sace panāvuso, bhikkhu paccavekkhamāno sabbepime pāpake akusale dhamme pahīne attani samanupassati, tenāvuso, bhikkhunā teneva pītipāmojjena vihātabbaṁ, ahorattānusikkhinā kusalesu dhammesū”ti.
root_text.mn15:8.9: Attamanā te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.

translation_text.mn15:1.2: At one time Venerable Mahāmoggallāna was staying in the land of the Bhaggas at Crocodile’s Bellow, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
translation_text.mn15:1.3: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:
translation_text.mn15:2.2: other mendicants to admonish them. But they’re hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish. They're impatient, and don't take instruction respectfully. So their spiritual companions don’t think it’s worth advising and instructing them, and that individual doesn’t gain their trust.
translation_text.mn15:3.1: And what are the qualities that make them hard to admonish?
translation_text.mn15:3.2: Firstly, a mendicant has corrupt wishes, having fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes.
translation_text.mn15:3.4: This is a quality that makes them difficult to admonish.
translation_text.mn15:3.5: Furthermore, a mendicant glorifies themselves and puts others down. …
translation_text.mn15:3.11: They’re irritable, and acrimonious due to anger …
translation_text.mn15:3.14: They’re irritable, and stubborn due to anger …
translation_text.mn15:3.17: They’re irritable, and blurt out words bordering on anger …
translation_text.mn15:3.20: When accused, they object to the accuser …
translation_text.mn15:3.23: When accused, they rebuke the accuser …
translation_text.mn15:3.26: When accused, they retort to the accuser …
translation_text.mn15:3.29: When accused, they dodge the issue, distract the discussion with irrelevant points, and display annoyance, hate, and bitterness …
translation_text.mn15:3.32: When accused, they are unable to account for the evidence …
translation_text.mn15:3.47: Furthermore, a mendicant is attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.
translation_text.mn15:3.49: This too is a quality that makes them difficult to admonish.
translation_text.mn15:3.50: These are the qualities that make them hard to admonish.
translation_text.mn15:4.2: other mendicants to admonish them. But they’re easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They're accepting, and take instruction respectfully. So their spiritual companions think it’s worth advising and instructing them, and that individual gains their trust.
translation_text.mn15:5.1: And what are the qualities that make them easy to admonish?
translation_text.mn15:5.2: Firstly, a mendicant doesn’t have corrupt wishes …
translation_text.mn15:5.47: Furthermore, a mendicant isn’t attached to their own views, not holding them tight, but letting them go easily.
translation_text.mn15:5.50: These are the qualities that make them easy to admonish.
translation_text.mn15:6.1: In such a case, a mendicant should measure themselves like this.
translation_text.mn15:6.2: ‘This individual has corrupt wishes, having fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. And I don’t like or approve of this individual.
translation_text.mn15:6.3: And if I were to fall under the sway of corrupt wishes, others wouldn’t like or approve of me.’
translation_text.mn15:6.4: A mendicant who knows this should give rise to the thought: ‘I will not fall under the sway of corrupt wishes.’ …
translation_text.mn15:6.47: ‘This individual is attached to their own views, holding them tight and refusing to let go. And I don’t like or approve of this individual.
translation_text.mn15:6.48: And if I were to be attached to my own views, holding them tight and refusing to let go, others wouldn’t like or approve of me.’
translation_text.mn15:6.49: A mendicant who knows this should give rise to the thought: ‘I will not be attached to my own views, holding them tight, but will let them go easily.’
translation_text.mn15:7.1: In such a case, a mendicant should check themselves like this:
translation_text.mn15:7.2: ‘Do I have corrupt wishes? Have I fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes?’
translation_text.mn15:7.3: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
translation_text.mn15:7.4: they have fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. Then they should make an effort to give up those bad, unskillful qualities.
translation_text.mn15:7.5: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
translation_text.mn15:7.6: they haven’t fallen under the sway of corrupt wishes. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities. …
translation_text.mn15:7.89: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
translation_text.mn15:7.90: they are attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go. Then they should make an effort to give up those bad, unskillful qualities.
translation_text.mn15:7.91: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant knows that
translation_text.mn15:7.92: they’re not attached to their own views, holding them tight, but let them go easily. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.
translation_text.mn15:8.1: Suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they haven’t given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should make an effort to give them all up.
translation_text.mn15:8.2: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they have given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.
translation_text.mn15:8.3: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and they check their own reflection in a clean bright mirror or a clear bowl of water. If they see any dirt or blemish there, they’d try to remove it.
translation_text.mn15:8.4: But if they don’t see any dirt or blemish there, they’re happy, thinking:
translation_text.mn15:8.6: In the same way, suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they haven’t given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should make an effort to give them all up.
translation_text.mn15:8.7: But suppose that, upon checking, a mendicant sees that they have given up all these bad, unskillful qualities. Then they should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.”
translation_text.mn15:8.8: This is what Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said.
translation_text.mn15:8.9: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said.
